title: Have played 162 ranked games this week trying to go from bronze 4 to bronze 3 with no success.
body:
Please, somebody help me.  I can't mentally handle being paired with bad teams and wasting my time anymore.  It's absolutely draining/killing me. 


Please add me, and help.

replies.body: If you play that many games and still are in B4, you deserve B4. Don't be ignorant, realise that you're the problem. There are literally hundreds of ways to improve. YouTube, summoner school, replays, streams, and even reading guides on mobafire. Start there and just keep playing, you will gradually gain divisions. It doesn't come quick. It took me a whole season to get out of bronze, just keep trying.

If I can go from Silver 1 to Gold 3 in 40 games. You can surely go up 1 division in 162 if you are good enough.

A little harsh truth, take it as you will: Riot will NEVER say this, but honestly, if you look at the ranking system, the actual ranking Pyramid starts with Silver. If you are Bronze, its basically saying you shouldn't have started ranked yet because you aren't good enough (also a reason why Bronze don't get borders since its not an achievement).

Tips for you friend.

Your cs'ing with Le Blanc is aboslutely horrendous. Like awful. You average 2.8 - 3 per 10 minutes when you should at MINIMUM be getting 6. Increasing your CS to that standard alone will get you into Silver on average since its basically doubling your gold from minions.
You get more CS as jungle Rengar than you do as Mid le blanc. Kinda bad. Dude, even if you have to take the extra damage to minions mastery and take AD marks just to last hit better, do it. Its worth it.

Your builds seem ok. You never build Zhonyas which is weird to me but its fine. Also, Lich Bane is not a good item on her.
Runes are ok too. A little greedy with the scaling HP rather than flat, but whatever, its fine.

Looking purely at your match history the only bad thing is your CS'ing, most other things Bronze people fail at you seem to be ok.

Your point about the pyramid is absolute nonsense and makes no sense. Someone has to be bronze. If everyone in bronze hadn't joined ranked, then every other player would be shifted down the pyramid. It has to be filled, it can't just not be there

Everyone ive seen from bronze to challenger in my opinion do not understand this game as much as they should but this is because the amount of impact a single player can make is almost nothing compared to the rest of their team. You are 1 out of 5 of your team and you cannot win a game without your team unless the enemy team is just that bad. So win or loss, from faker to a bronzie, they are never the sole reason for a win or loss. Since that is all riot currently dictates as your level of ability, it is literally impossible for a player to achieve their true rank systematically. No one should be judged by their rank.

Riot have even announced that they are under serving those who wish to communicate their individual performance. This needs more global recognition though because everyone still seems to be completely oblivious to it.

Would agree with this mainly. Work on your cs. Also, if you wanna climb, don't play support, it's too reliant on noob teammates to carry. If you do play support, remember your two most important roles: vision control, and peeling for your carries. In the games in your history, you are not getting a sweeping lens to deny the enemy vision around objectives. You'll still lose a lot of games as support, even when you do your best though, it's best to play mid lane, or jungle in my opinion. Because then at least you can get one lane of your noob team ahead, it gives you some winning conditions.

All of these mathematical arguments about which team has afk/feeders/trolls/noobs are irrelevant in the long term at low elo. After a while you will start to climb if you are better than the average noob in a carry role. This season I was placed in Bronze 2, and went straight to Silver 5 without much effort (playing support btw). And I was Silver 4 last season. In your teams you'll get heaps of shitters that don't watch pro games, or try to improve, and only play for winning, even when they don't know how to win. Of course they will remain shitters. So just work on your play, and find some niche champions that suit your style. Also if dickheads in your team try to make you do something you don't want to do (e.g. you are a split pushing Tryndamere and they tell you to group for some stupid fight in the jungle over no objective whatsoever), think what's best and if that is just doing your own thing (e.g. getting the next tower), then do that. Don't be swayed by a pack of noobs. They will never learn, they will always blame, and they will always be low elo. Don't fall into their trap. Mute them and move on to winning ways.

After a while you will be able to smash noobs with ease.

[Check out this game where I duoed with a Bronze 3 Zed in the bot lane](http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/133129463/200912352?tab=overview).  Pure trolling (still trying to win of course), just for kicks.

Good Luck!

The whole argument in the comments section is pretty stupid. 

Suck less, get better. Simple.
i have played about 25 so far and have risen from S5 0LP to S3 60LP

Games are often decided by one player. The surest way to win or lose is that bad player having a bad game. Your team, you lose, theirs you win.
Luck does play a major part in deciding outcomes, so many games are decided on load screen.

Having said that after 100+ games luck would of evened out...

The next surest way to win and climb (other than being lucky) is to be a hard carry and be that carry every game.

Being a support means you are far more dependent upon luck to win whereas being a great mid means you can win even with bad players on your team.

Hey, the important thing is to always be looking to improve yourself. Do not blame bad teams as the reason you cannot climb as this is not true. Sure, they may slow your progress, but you get good and decent teams just as often as well. Also you do not improve and climb by blaming your teams.
I was literally falling between Bronze III and IV the first 40 or so games this season. My win rate was horrendous. Then in the next 60 games, I climbed from Bronze IV 80LP to Silver V at about 60-65% win rate. It was the fastest and most consistent I have ever climbed (and I spent 550 games in Bronze last season). What did I do? I went into nearly every game with a strong mindset, set on the art of winning, set on taking down objectives, taking down every part of the enemy's base and not caring about KDA. There are also a few other things, such as not getting caught and dying. Improving your map awareness and decision making will help with this.

Another thing is not tilting from your losses, but accepting them and moving on. I used to tilt so bad after certain games it would cause a significant loss streak. Some losses are beyond your control, but what is in your control is how much you tilt after those losses. I have a rule that if I lose 2 games in a row I usually stop for the day (or at least for a few hours).

Also do what Ryuku said, I watch at least 5 hours of LoL YouTube videos a week, read guides etc.
Haha I just somehow had a 12 win streak and then went from b5 to b3 in 2 days. Feelsgoodman

I feel ya mate. I sucks I know. I'm there ato the moment, but not worried. Just work on what you can do for the team only. Not what you think they should be doing for you. You can't control that, you can only be positive and make suggestions to your team. Not fight against them. Otherwise it will be twice as hard.
one of your problems is csing. thats one direction to improve
